markdownRemark.html:
Convincing yourself that some things wouldn't work out is hard. I wrote this one in an attempt to believe it, hiding the predictable title choice behind an acronym.

YDWML!

Feeling too much and too fast
Itâ€™s not healthy for me
Not healthy for you if you knew
Iâ€™ve been transparent in every move
If you wanted this, it would show through

I canâ€™t force down the beating
And Iâ€™ve been dreaming of
Back-to-back endless nights
But I think I shouldâ€™ve made myself clearer
Weâ€™re back-to-back, but the wrong type
What I really wanted was eye to eye

You donâ€™t want my love
And it hurts, I canâ€™t lie, I canâ€™t deny
But donâ€™t you make it rough
Iâ€™ve already lost all my will to fight
You donâ€™t want my love
And it hurts, but itâ€™s alright, itâ€™s alright
I donâ€™t want your love
â€˜Cause you wouldnâ€™t love me enough

I wonâ€™t be fighting for you
By now I should be done seeking approval
Almost at the end of the line
And these feelings that I canâ€™t define
Trapping me up, tighteningly brutal

But I canâ€™t force down the beating
And Iâ€™ve been dreaming of
Things that Iâ€™ve never done before
And somehow, Iâ€™d really want some more

You donâ€™t want my love

But donâ€™t you make it rough
Iâ€™ve already lost all my will to fight

Funny how sincerityâ€™s in your lips
Even when theyâ€™re forever shut
I have you on my mind when I go to sleep
And you're my first thought when I wake up
Each time I think about us, it's so absurd
Because itâ€™s obvious that

You donâ€™t want my love

And it hurts, but itâ€™s alright, itâ€™s alright

frontmatter.title: YDWML!
frontmatter.description: Not healthy for me, not healthy for you if you knew.

messages.title: Poems With Choruses
messages.description: Documenting life as I try to fit it in the lyrics of a song.
messages.author: Robson Junior
